summary.long: Proverbs is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon the son of David, king of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To know wisdom and instruction,
To perceive the words of understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To receive the instruction of wisdom,
Justice, judgment, and equity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To give prudence to the simple,
To the young man knowledge and discretion—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man will hear and increase learning,
And a man of understanding will attain wise counsel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To understand a proverb and an enigma,
The words of the wise and their riddles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge,
But fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, hear the instruction of your father,
And do not forsake the law of your mother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they will be a graceful ornament on your head,
And chains about your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if sinners entice you,
Do not consent.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let us swallow them alive like Sheol,
And whole, like those who go down to the Pit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We shall find all kinds of precious possessions,
We shall fill our houses with spoil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast in your lot among us,
Let us all have one purse”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not walk in the way with them,
Keep your foot from their path;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their feet run to evil,
And they make haste to shed blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely, in vain the net is spread
In the sight of any bird;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they lie in wait for their own blood,
They lurk secretly for their own lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So are the ways of everyone who is greedy for gain;
It takes away the life of its owners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom calls aloud outside;
She raises her voice in the open squares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She cries out in the chief concourses,
At the openings of the gates in the city
She speaks her words:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long, you simple ones, will you love simplicity?
For scorners delight in their scorning,
And fools hate knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Because I have called and you refused,
I have stretched out my hand and no one regarded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because you disdained all my counsel,
And would have none of my rebuke,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also will laugh at your calamity;
I will mock when your terror comes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When your terror comes like a storm,
And your destruction comes like a whirlwind,
When distress and anguish come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then they will call on me, but I will not answer;
They will seek me diligently, but they will not find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they hated knowledge
And did not choose the fear of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They would have none of my counsel
And despised my every rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore they shall eat the fruit of their own way,
And be filled to the full with their own fancies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the turning away of the simple will slay them,
And the complacency of fools will destroy them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But whoever listens to me will dwell safely,
And will be secure, without fear of evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you receive my words,
And treasure my commands within you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that you incline your ear to wisdom,
And apply your heart to understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, if you cry out for discernment,
And lift up your voice for understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you seek her as silver,
And search for her as for hidden treasures;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will understand the fear of the Lord,
And find the knowledge of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord gives wisdom;
From His mouth come knowledge and understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stores up sound wisdom for the upright;
He is a shield to those who walk uprightly;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He guards the paths of justice,
And preserves the way of His saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will understand righteousness and justice,
Equity and every good path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When wisdom enters your heart,
And knowledge is pleasant to your soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Discretion will preserve you;
Understanding will keep you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To deliver you from the way of evil,
From the man who speaks perverse things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From those who leave the paths of uprightness
To walk in the ways of darkness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who rejoice in doing evil,
And delight in the perversity of the wicked;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whose ways are crooked,
And who are devious in their paths;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To deliver you from the immoral woman,
From the seductress who flatters with her words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who forsakes the companion of her youth,
And forgets the covenant of her God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For her house leads down to death,
And her paths to the dead;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
None who go to her return,
Nor do they regain the paths of life—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So you may walk in the way of goodness,
And keep to the paths of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the upright will dwell in the land,
And the blameless will remain in it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the wicked will be cut off from the earth,
And the unfaithful will be uprooted from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not forget my law,
But let your heart keep my commands;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For length of days and long life
And peace they will add to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And so find favor and high esteem
In the sight of God and man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust in the Lord with all your heart,
And lean not on your own understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In all your ways acknowledge Him,
And He shall direct your paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be wise in your own eyes;
Fear the Lord and depart from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be health to your flesh,
And strength to your bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honor the Lord with your possessions,
And with the firstfruits of all your increase;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So your barns will be filled with plenty,
And your vats will overflow with new wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not despise the chastening of the Lord,
Nor detest His correction;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For whom the Lord loves He corrects,
Just as a father the son in whom he delights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy is the man who finds wisdom,
And the man who gains understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For her proceeds are better than the profits of silver,
And her gain than fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is more precious than rubies,
And all the things you may desire cannot compare with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Length of days is in her right hand,
In her left hand riches and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her ways are ways of pleasantness,
And all her paths are peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is a tree of life to those who take hold of her,
And happy are all who retain her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord by wisdom founded the earth;
By understanding He established the heavens;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By His knowledge the depths were broken up,
And clouds drop down the dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, let them not depart from your eyes—
Keep sound wisdom and discretion;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So they will be life to your soul
And grace to your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will walk safely in your way,
And your foot will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you lie down, you will not be afraid;
Yes, you will lie down and your sleep will be sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be afraid of sudden terror,
Nor of trouble from the wicked when it comes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will be your confidence,
And will keep your foot from being caught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due,
When it is in the power of your hand to do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say to your neighbor,
“Go, and come back,
And tomorrow I will give it,”
When you have it with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not devise evil against your neighbor,
For he dwells by you for safety’s sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not strive with a man without cause,
If he has done you no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not envy the oppressor,
And choose none of his ways;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the perverse person is an abomination to the Lord,
But His secret counsel is with the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The curse of the Lord is on the house of the wicked,
But He blesses the home of the just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely He scorns the scornful,
But gives grace to the humble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise shall inherit glory,
But shame shall be the legacy of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, my children, the instruction of a father,
And give attention to know understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I give you good doctrine:
Do not forsake my law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I was my father’s son,
Tender and the only one in the sight of my mother,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Get wisdom! Get understanding!
Do not forget, nor turn away from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not forsake her, and she will preserve you;
Love her, and she will keep you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Exalt her, and she will promote you;
She will bring you honor, when you embrace her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She will place on your head an ornament of grace;
A crown of glory she will deliver to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, my son, and receive my sayings,
And the years of your life will be many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have taught you in the way of wisdom;
I have led you in right paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you walk, your steps will not be hindered,
And when you run, you will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take firm hold of instruction, do not let go;
Keep her, for she is your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not enter the path of the wicked,
And do not walk in the way of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Avoid it, do not travel on it;
Turn away from it and pass on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they do not sleep unless they have done evil;
And their sleep is taken away unless they make someone fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they eat the bread of wickedness,
And drink the wine of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the path of the just is like the shining sun,
That shines ever brighter unto the perfect day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the wicked is like darkness;
They do not know what makes them stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, give attention to my words;
Incline your ear to my sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let them depart from your eyes;
Keep them in the midst of your heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they are life to those who find them,
And health to all their flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep your heart with all diligence,
For out of it spring the issues of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put away from you a deceitful mouth,
And put perverse lips far from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your eyes look straight ahead,
And your eyelids look right before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ponder the path of your feet,
And let all your ways be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not turn to the right or the left;
Remove your foot from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, pay attention to my wisdom;
Lend your ear to my understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That you may preserve discretion,
And your lips may keep knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the lips of an immoral woman drip honey,
And her mouth is smoother than oil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But in the end she is bitter as wormwood,
Sharp as a two-edged sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her feet go down to death,
Her steps lay hold of hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore hear me now, my children,
And do not depart from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove your way far from her,
And do not go near the door of her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lest you give your honor to others,
And your years to the cruel one;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lest aliens be filled with your wealth,
And your labors go to the house of a foreigner;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And you mourn at last,
When your flesh and your body are consumed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And say:
“How I have hated instruction,
And my heart despised correction!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not obeyed the voice of my teachers,
Nor inclined my ear to those who instructed me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was on the verge of total ruin,
In the midst of the assembly and congregation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Drink water from your own cistern,
And running water from your own well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should your fountains be dispersed abroad,
Streams of water in the streets?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be only your own,
And not for strangers with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your fountain be blessed,
And rejoice with the wife of your youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For why should you, my son, be enraptured by an immoral woman,
And be embraced in the arms of a seductress?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the ways of man are before the eyes of the Lord,
And He ponders all his paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His own iniquities entrap the wicked man,
And he is caught in the cords of his sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall die for lack of instruction,
And in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you become surety for your friend,
If you have shaken hands in pledge for a stranger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are snared by the words of your mouth;
You are taken by the words of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Give no sleep to your eyes,
Nor slumber to your eyelids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver yourself like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter,
And like a bird from the hand of the fowler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go to the ant, you sluggard!
Consider her ways and be wise,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which, having no captain,
Overseer or ruler,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Provides her supplies in the summer,
And gathers her food in the harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you slumber, O sluggard?
When will you rise from your sleep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A little sleep, a little slumber,
A little folding of the hands to sleep—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So shall your poverty come on you like a prowler,
And your need like an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A worthless person, a wicked man,
Walks with a perverse mouth;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Perversity is in his heart,
He devises evil continually,
He sows discord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore his calamity shall come suddenly;
Suddenly he shall be broken without remedy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These six things the Lord hates,
Yes, seven are an abomination to Him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A proud look,
A lying tongue,
Hands that shed innocent blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A heart that devises wicked plans,
Feet that are swift in running to evil,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness who speaks lies,
And one who sows discord among brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, keep your father’s command,
And do not forsake the law of your mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bind them continually upon your heart;
Tie them around your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
To keep you from the evil woman,
From the flattering tongue of a seductress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not lust after her beauty in your heart,
Nor let her allure you with her eyelids.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Can a man take fire to his bosom,
And his clothes not be burned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can one walk on hot coals,
And his feet not be seared?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So is he who goes in to his neighbor’s wife;
Whoever touches her shall not be innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
People do not despise a thief
If he steals to satisfy himself when he is starving.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet when he is found, he must restore sevenfold;
He may have to give up all the substance of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever commits adultery with a woman lacks understanding;
He who does so destroys his own soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wounds and dishonor he will get,
And his reproach will not be wiped away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For jealousy is a husband’s fury;
Therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will accept no recompense,
Nor will he be appeased though you give many gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, keep my words,
And treasure my commands within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep my commands and live,
And my law as the apple of your eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bind them on your fingers;
Write them on the tablet of your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,”
And call understanding your nearest kin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That they may keep you from the immoral woman,
From the seductress who flatters with her words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For at the window of my house
I looked through my lattice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And saw among the simple,
I perceived among the youths,
A young man devoid of understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Passing along the street near her corner;
And he took the path to her house
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the twilight, in the evening,
In the black and dark night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And there a woman met him,
With the attire of a harlot, and a crafty heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She was loud and rebellious,
Her feet would not stay at home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At times she was outside, at times in the open square,
Lurking at every corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So she caught him and kissed him;
With an impudent face she said to him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have peace offerings with me;
Today I have paid my vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So I came out to meet you,
Diligently to seek your face,
And I have found you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have spread my bed with tapestry,
Colored coverings of Egyptian linen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have perfumed my bed
With myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let us take our fill of love until morning;
Let us delight ourselves with love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my husband is not at home;
He has gone on a long journey;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has taken a bag of money with him,
And will come home on the appointed day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With her enticing speech she caused him to yield,
With her flattering lips she seduced him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Immediately he went after her, as an ox goes to the slaughter,
Or as a fool to the correction of the stocks,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Till an arrow struck his liver.
As a bird hastens to the snare,
He did not know it would cost his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now therefore, listen to me, my children;
Pay attention to the words of my mouth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let your heart turn aside to her ways,
Do not stray into her paths;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For she has cast down many wounded,
And all who were slain by her were strong men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her house is the way to hell,
Descending to the chambers of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does not wisdom cry out,
And understanding lift up her voice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She takes her stand on the top of the high hill,
Beside the way, where the paths meet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She cries out by the gates, at the entry of the city,
At the entrance of the doors:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To you, O men, I call,
And my voice is to the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O you simple ones, understand prudence,
And you fools, be of an understanding heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen, for I will speak of excellent things,
And from the opening of my lips will come right things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my mouth will speak truth;
Wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the words of my mouth are with righteousness;
Nothing crooked or perverse is in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are all plain to him who understands,
And right to those who find knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Receive my instruction, and not silver,
And knowledge rather than choice gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For wisdom is better than rubies,
And all the things one may desire cannot be compared with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I, wisdom, dwell with prudence,
And find out knowledge and discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom;
I am understanding, I have strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By me kings reign,
And rulers decree justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By me princes rule, and nobles,
All the judges of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I love those who love me,
And those who seek me diligently will find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Riches and honor are with me,
Enduring riches and righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My fruit is better than gold, yes, than fine gold,
And my revenue than choice silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I traverse the way of righteousness,
In the midst of the paths of justice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That I may cause those who love me to inherit wealth,
That I may fill their treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord possessed me at the beginning of His way,
Before His works of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have been established from everlasting,
From the beginning, before there was ever an earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When there were no depths I was brought forth,
When there were no fountains abounding with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before the mountains were settled,
Before the hills, I was brought forth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
While as yet He had not made the earth or the fields,
Or the primal dust of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He prepared the heavens, I was there,
When He drew a circle on the face of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He established the clouds above,
When He strengthened the fountains of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He assigned to the sea its limit,
So that the waters would not transgress His command,
When He marked out the foundations of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Rejoicing in His inhabited world,
And my delight was with the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now therefore, listen to me, my children,
For blessed are those who keep my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear instruction and be wise,
And do not disdain it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the man who listens to me,
Watching daily at my gates,
Waiting at the posts of my doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For whoever finds me finds life,
And obtains favor from the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he who sins against me wrongs his own soul;
All those who hate me love death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom has built her house,
She has hewn out her seven pillars;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has slaughtered her meat,
She has mixed her wine,
She has also furnished her table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has sent out her maidens,
She cries out from the highest places of the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever is simple, let him turn in here!”
As for him who lacks understanding, she says to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come, eat of my bread
And drink of the wine I have mixed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Forsake foolishness and live,
And go in the way of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He who corrects a scoffer gets shame for himself,
And he who rebukes a wicked man only harms himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not correct a scoffer, lest he hate you;
Rebuke a wise man, and he will love you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be still wiser;
Teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom,
And the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For by me your days will be multiplied,
And years of life will be added to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you are wise, you are wise for yourself,
And if you scoff, you will bear it alone.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish woman is clamorous;
She is simple, and knows nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For she sits at the door of her house,
On a seat by the highest places of the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To call to those who pass by,
Who go straight on their way:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever is simple, let him turn in here”;
And as for him who lacks understanding, she says to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Stolen water is sweet,
And bread eaten in secret is pleasant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he does not know that the dead are there,
That her guests are in the depths of hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proverbs of Solomon:
A wise son makes a glad father,
But a foolish son is the grief of his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Treasures of wickedness profit nothing,
But righteousness delivers from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will not allow the righteous soul to famish,
But He casts away the desire of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who has a slack hand becomes poor,
But the hand of the diligent makes rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who gathers in summer is a wise son;
He who sleeps in harvest is a son who causes shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessings are on the head of the righteous,
But violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The memory of the righteous is blessed,
But the name of the wicked will rot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise in heart will receive commands,
But a prating fool will fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who walks with integrity walks securely,
But he who perverts his ways will become known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who winks with the eye causes trouble,
But a prating fool will fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of the righteous is a well of life,
But violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hatred stirs up strife,
But love covers all sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is found on the lips of him who has understanding,
But a rod is for the back of him who is devoid of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wise people store up knowledge,
But the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich man’s wealth is his strong city;
The destruction of the poor is their poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The labor of the righteous leads to life,
The wages of the wicked to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who keeps instruction is in the way of life,
But he who refuses correction goes astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever hides hatred has lying lips,
And whoever spreads slander is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the multitude of words sin is not lacking,
But he who restrains his lips is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the righteous is choice silver;
The heart of the wicked is worth little.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the righteous feed many,
But fools die for lack of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blessing of the Lord makes one rich,
And He adds no sorrow with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To do evil is like sport to a fool,
But a man of understanding has wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the wicked will come upon him,
And the desire of the righteous will be granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the whirlwind passes by, the wicked is no more,
But the righteous has an everlasting foundation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes,
So is the lazy man to those who send him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord prolongs days,
But the years of the wicked will be shortened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hope of the righteous will be gladness,
But the expectation of the wicked will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the Lord is strength for the upright,
But destruction will come to the workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will never be removed,
But the wicked will not inhabit the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom,
But the perverse tongue will be cut out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable,
But the mouth of the wicked what is perverse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dishonest scales are an abomination to the Lord,
But a just weight is His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When pride comes, then comes shame;
But with the humble is wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The integrity of the upright will guide them,
But the perversity of the unfaithful will destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Riches do not profit in the day of wrath,
But righteousness delivers from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way aright,
But the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of the upright will deliver them,
But the unfaithful will be caught by their lust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a wicked man dies, his expectation will perish,
And the hope of the unjust perishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous is delivered from trouble,
And it comes to the wicked instead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbor,
But through knowledge the righteous will be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices;
And when the wicked perish, there is jubilation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted,
But it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is devoid of wisdom despises his neighbor,
But a man of understanding holds his peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A talebearer reveals secrets,
But he who is of a faithful spirit conceals a matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where there is no counsel, the people fall;
But in the multitude of counselors there is safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is surety for a stranger will suffer,
But one who hates being surety is secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gracious woman retains honor,
But ruthless men retain riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The merciful man does good for his own soul,
But he who is cruel troubles his own flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked man does deceptive work,
But he who sows righteousness will have a sure reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As righteousness leads to life,
So he who pursues evil pursues it to his own death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who are of a perverse heart are an abomination to the Lord,
But the blameless in their ways are His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though they join forces, the wicked will not go unpunished;
But the posterity of the righteous will be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a ring of gold in a swine’s snout,
So is a lovely woman who lacks discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of the righteous is only good,
But the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The generous soul will be made rich,
And he who waters will also be watered himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people will curse him who withholds grain,
But blessing will be on the head of him who sells it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who earnestly seeks good finds favor,
But trouble will come to him who seeks evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who trusts in his riches will fall,
But the righteous will flourish like foliage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who troubles his own house will inherit the wind,
And the fool will be servant to the wise of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life,
And he who wins souls is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the righteous will be recompensed on the earth,
How much more the ungodly and the sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever loves instruction loves knowledge,
But he who hates correction is stupid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good man obtains favor from the Lord,
But a man of wicked intentions He will condemn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man is not established by wickedness,
But the root of the righteous cannot be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An excellent wife is the crown of her husband,
But she who causes shame is like rottenness in his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The thoughts of the righteous are right,
But the counsels of the wicked are deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of the wicked are, “Lie in wait for blood,”
But the mouth of the upright will deliver them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked are overthrown and are no more,
But the house of the righteous will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man will be commended according to his wisdom,
But he who is of a perverse heart will be despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is the one who is slighted but has a servant,
Than he who honors himself but lacks bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous man regards the life of his animal,
But the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who tills his land will be satisfied with bread,
But he who follows frivolity is devoid of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked covet the catch of evil men,
But the root of the righteous yields fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked is ensnared by the transgression of his lips,
But the righteous will come through trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man will be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth,
And the recompense of a man’s hands will be rendered to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,
But he who heeds counsel is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s wrath is known at once,
But a prudent man covers shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who speaks truth declares righteousness,
But a false witness, deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is one who speaks like the piercings of a sword,
But the tongue of the wise promotes health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The truthful lip shall be established forever,
But a lying tongue is but for a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deceit is in the heart of those who devise evil,
But counselors of peace have joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No grave trouble will overtake the righteous,
But the wicked shall be filled with evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lying lips are an abomination to the Lord,
But those who deal truthfully are His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A prudent man conceals knowledge,
But the heart of fools proclaims foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hand of the diligent will rule,
But the lazy man will be put to forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Anxiety in the heart of man causes depression,
But a good word makes it glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous should choose his friends carefully,
For the way of the wicked leads them astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lazy man does not roast what he took in hunting,
But diligence is man’s precious possession.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the way of righteousness is life,
And in its pathway there is no death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son heeds his father’s instruction,
But a scoffer does not listen to rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man shall eat well by the fruit of his mouth,
But the soul of the unfaithful feeds on violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who guards his mouth preserves his life,
But he who opens wide his lips shall have destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The soul of a lazy man desires, and has nothing;
But the soul of the diligent shall be made rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous man hates lying,
But a wicked man is loathsome and comes to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness guards him whose way is blameless,
But wickedness overthrows the sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is one who makes himself rich, yet has nothing;
And one who makes himself poor, yet has great riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ransom of a man’s life is his riches,
But the poor does not hear rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light of the righteous rejoices,
But the lamp of the wicked will be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By pride comes nothing but strife,
But with the well-advised is wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth gained by dishonesty will be diminished,
But he who gathers by labor will increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hope deferred makes the heart sick,
But when the desire comes, it is a tree of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who despises the word will be destroyed,
But he who fears the commandment will be rewarded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The law of the wise is a fountain of life,
To turn one away from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good understanding gains favor,
But the way of the unfaithful is hard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every prudent man acts with knowledge,
But a fool lays open his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked messenger falls into trouble,
But a faithful ambassador brings health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Poverty and shame will come to him who disdains correction,
But he who regards a rebuke will be honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A desire accomplished is sweet to the soul,
But it is an abomination to fools to depart from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who walks with wise men will be wise,
But the companion of fools will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evil pursues sinners,
But to the righteous, good shall be repaid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children,
But the wealth of the sinner is stored up for the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Much food is in the fallow ground of the poor,
And for lack of justice there is waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who spares his rod hates his son,
But he who loves him disciplines him promptly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous eats to the satisfying of his soul,
But the stomach of the wicked shall be in want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise woman builds her house,
But the foolish pulls it down with her hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who walks in his uprightness fears the Lord,
But he who is perverse in his ways despises Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the mouth of a fool is a rod of pride,
But the lips of the wise will preserve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where no oxen are, the trough is clean;
But much increase comes by the strength of an ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A faithful witness does not lie,
But a false witness will utter lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A scoffer seeks wisdom and does not find it,
But knowledge is easy to him who understands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go from the presence of a foolish man,
When you do not perceive in him the lips of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way,
But the folly of fools is deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fools mock at sin,
But among the upright there is favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart knows its own bitterness,
And a stranger does not share its joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The house of the wicked will be overthrown,
But the tent of the upright will flourish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way that seems right to a man,
But its end is the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even in laughter the heart may sorrow,
And the end of mirth may be grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The backslider in heart will be filled with his own ways,
But a good man will be satisfied from above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The simple believes every word,
But the prudent considers well his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man fears and departs from evil,
But a fool rages and is self-confident.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A quick-tempered man acts foolishly,
And a man of wicked intentions is hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The simple inherit folly,
But the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The evil will bow before the good,
And the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor man is hated even by his own neighbor,
But the rich has many friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who despises his neighbor sins;
But he who has mercy on the poor, happy is he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do they not go astray who devise evil?
But mercy and truth belong to those who devise good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In all labor there is profit,
But idle chatter leads only to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crown of the wise is their riches,
But the foolishness of fools is folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A true witness delivers souls,
But a deceitful witness speaks lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the fear of the Lord there is strong confidence,
And His children will have a place of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life,
To turn one away from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In a multitude of people is a king’s honor,
But in the lack of people is the downfall of a prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is slow to wrath has great understanding,
But he who is impulsive exalts folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sound heart is life to the body,
But envy is rottenness to the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who oppresses the poor reproaches his Maker,
But he who honors Him has mercy on the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked is banished in his wickedness,
But the righteous has a refuge in his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom rests in the heart of him who has understanding,
But what is in the heart of fools is made known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness exalts a nation,
But sin is a reproach to any people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s favor is toward a wise servant,
But his wrath is against him who causes shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A soft answer turns away wrath,
But a harsh word stirs up anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the wise uses knowledge rightly,
But the mouth of fools pours forth foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord are in every place,
Keeping watch on the evil and the good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wholesome tongue is a tree of life,
But perverseness in it breaks the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool despises his father’s instruction,
But he who receives correction is prudent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the house of the righteous there is much treasure,
But in the revenue of the wicked is trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the wise disperse knowledge,
But the heart of the fool does not do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,
But the prayer of the upright is His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,
But He loves him who follows righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Harsh discipline is for him who forsakes the way,
And he who hates correction will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hell and Destruction are before the Lord;
So how much more the hearts of the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A scoffer does not love one who corrects him,
Nor will he go to the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A merry heart makes a cheerful countenance,
But by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of him who has understanding seeks knowledge,
But the mouth of fools feeds on foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the days of the afflicted are evil,
But he who is of a merry heart has a continual feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a little with the fear of the Lord,
Than great treasure with trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a dinner of herbs where love is,
Than a fatted calf with hatred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wrathful man stirs up strife,
But he who is slow to anger allays contention.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the lazy man is like a hedge of thorns,
But the way of the upright is a highway.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son makes a father glad,
But a foolish man despises his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Folly is joy to him who is destitute of discernment,
But a man of understanding walks uprightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Without counsel, plans go awry,
But in the multitude of counselors they are established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man has joy by the answer of his mouth,
And a word spoken in due season, how good it is!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of life winds upward for the wise,
That he may turn away from hell below.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will destroy the house of the proud,
But He will establish the boundary of the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the Lord,
But the words of the pure are pleasant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is greedy for gain troubles his own house,
But he who hates bribes will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the righteous studies how to answer,
But the mouth of the wicked pours forth evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is far from the wicked,
But He hears the prayer of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light of the eyes rejoices the heart,
And a good report makes the bones healthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ear that hears the rebukes of life
Will abide among the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who disdains instruction despises his own soul,
But he who heeds rebuke gets understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the instruction of wisdom,
And before honor is humility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The preparations of the heart belong to man,
But the answer of the tongue is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the ways of a man are pure in his own eyes,
But the Lord weighs the spirits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Commit your works to the Lord,
And your thoughts will be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has made all for Himself,
Yes, even the wicked for the day of doom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord;
Though they join forces, none will go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When a man’s ways please the Lord,
He makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a little with righteousness,
Than vast revenues without justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s heart plans his way,
But the Lord directs his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Divination is on the lips of the king;
His mouth must not transgress in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honest weights and scales are the Lord’s;
All the weights in the bag are His work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is an abomination for kings to commit wickedness,
For a throne is established by righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteous lips are the delight of kings,
And they love him who speaks what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As messengers of death is the king’s wrath,
But a wise man will appease it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the light of the king’s face is life,
And his favor is like a cloud of the latter rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much better to get wisdom than gold!
And to get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The highway of the upright is to depart from evil;
He who keeps his way preserves his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pride goes before destruction,
And a haughty spirit before a fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to be of a humble spirit with the lowly,
Than to divide the spoil with the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who heeds the word wisely will find good,
And whoever trusts in the Lord, happy is he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise in heart will be called prudent,
And sweetness of the lips increases learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Understanding is a wellspring of life to him who has it.
But the correction of fools is folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the wise teaches his mouth,
And adds learning to his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pleasant words are like a honeycomb,
Sweetness to the soul and health to the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way that seems right to a man,
But its end is the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The person who labors, labors for himself,
For his hungry mouth drives him on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An ungodly man digs up evil,
And it is on his lips like a burning fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A perverse man sows strife,
And a whisperer separates the best of friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A violent man entices his neighbor,
And leads him in a way that is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He winks his eye to devise perverse things;
He purses his lips and brings about evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The silver-haired head is a crown of glory,
If it is found in the way of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is slow to anger is better than the mighty,
And he who rules his spirit than he who takes a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lot is cast into the lap,
But its every decision is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a dry morsel with quietness,
Than a house full of feasting with strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise servant will rule over a son who causes shame,
And will share an inheritance among the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The refining pot is for silver and the furnace for gold,
But the Lord tests the hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evildoer gives heed to false lips;
A liar listens eagerly to a spiteful tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who mocks the poor reproaches his Maker;
He who is glad at calamity will not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Children’s children are the crown of old men,
And the glory of children is their father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Excellent speech is not becoming to a fool,
Much less lying lips to a prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A present is a precious stone in the eyes of its possessor;
Wherever he turns, he prospers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who covers a transgression seeks love,
But he who repeats a matter separates friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Rebuke is more effective for a wise man
Than a hundred blows on a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evil man seeks only rebellion;
Therefore a cruel messenger will be sent against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let a man meet a bear robbed of her cubs,
Rather than a fool in his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever rewards evil for good,
Evil will not depart from his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The beginning of strife is like releasing water;
Therefore stop contention before a quarrel starts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who justifies the wicked, and he who condemns the just,
Both of them alike are an abomination to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is there in the hand of a fool the purchase price of wisdom,
Since he has no heart for it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A friend loves at all times,
And a brother is born for adversity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man devoid of understanding shakes hands in a pledge,
And becomes surety for his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who loves transgression loves strife,
And he who exalts his gate seeks destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who has a deceitful heart finds no good,
And he who has a perverse tongue falls into evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who begets a scoffer does so to his sorrow,
And the father of a fool has no joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A merry heart does good, like medicine,
But a broken spirit dries the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked man accepts a bribe behind the back
To pervert the ways of justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is in the sight of him who has understanding,
But the eyes of a fool are on the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish son is a grief to his father,
And bitterness to her who bore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also, to punish the righteous is not good,
Nor to strike princes for their uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who has knowledge spares his words,
And a man of understanding is of a calm spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even a fool is counted wise when he holds his peace;
When he shuts his lips, he is considered perceptive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who isolates himself seeks his own desire;
He rages against all wise judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool has no delight in understanding,
But in expressing his own heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked comes, contempt comes also;
And with dishonor comes reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a man’s mouth are deep waters;
The wellspring of wisdom is a flowing brook.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not good to show partiality to the wicked,
Or to overthrow the righteous in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s lips enter into contention,
And his mouth calls for blows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s mouth is his destruction,
And his lips are the snare of his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a talebearer are like tasty trifles,
And they go down into the inmost body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is slothful in his work
Is a brother to him who is a great destroyer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The name of the Lord is a strong tower;
The righteous run to it and are safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich man’s wealth is his strong city,
And like a high wall in his own esteem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before destruction the heart of a man is haughty,
And before honor is humility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who answers a matter before he hears it,
It is folly and shame to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The spirit of a man will sustain him in sickness,
But who can bear a broken spirit?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the prudent acquires knowledge,
And the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s gift makes room for him,
And brings him before great men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The first one to plead his cause seems right,
Until his neighbor comes and examines him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Casting lots causes contentions to cease,
And keeps the mighty apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A brother offended is harder to win than a strong city,
And contentions are like the bars of a castle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s stomach shall be satisfied from the fruit of his mouth;
From the produce of his lips he shall be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
And those who love it will eat its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who finds a wife finds a good thing,
And obtains favor from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor man uses entreaties,
But the rich answers roughly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who has friends must himself be friendly,
But there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is the poor who walks in his integrity
Than one who is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also it is not good for a soul to be without knowledge,
And he sins who hastens with his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The foolishness of a man twists his way,
And his heart frets against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth makes many friends,
But the poor is separated from his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not go unpunished,
And he who speaks lies will not escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many entreat the favor of the nobility,
And every man is a friend to one who gives gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He who gets wisdom loves his own soul;
He who keeps understanding will find good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not go unpunished,
And he who speaks lies shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Luxury is not fitting for a fool,
Much less for a servant to rule over princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The discretion of a man makes him slow to anger,
And his glory is to overlook a transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s wrath is like the roaring of a lion,
But his favor is like dew on the grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish son is the ruin of his father,
And the contentions of a wife are a continual dripping.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Houses and riches are an inheritance from fathers,
But a prudent wife is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Laziness casts one into a deep sleep,
And an idle person will suffer hunger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who keeps the commandment keeps his soul,
But he who is careless of his ways will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who has pity on the poor lends to the Lord,
And He will pay back what he has given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Chasten your son while there is hope,
And do not set your heart on his destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man of great wrath will suffer punishment;
For if you rescue him, you will have to do it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to counsel and receive instruction,
That you may be wise in your latter days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are many plans in a man’s heart,
Nevertheless the Lord’s counsel—that will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is desired in a man is kindness,
And a poor man is better than a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
A lazy man buries his hand in the bowl,
And will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strike a scoffer, and the simple will become wary;
Rebuke one who has understanding, and he will discern knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who mistreats his father and chases away his mother
Is a son who causes shame and brings reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cease listening to instruction, my son,
And you will stray from the words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A disreputable witness scorns justice,
And the mouth of the wicked devours iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judgments are prepared for scoffers,
And beatings for the backs of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wine is a mocker,
Strong drink is a brawler,
And whoever is led astray by it is not wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wrath of a king is like the roaring of a lion;
Whoever provokes him to anger sins against his own life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is honorable for a man to stop striving,
Since any fool can start a quarrel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lazy man will not plow because of winter;
He will beg during harvest and have nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water,
But a man of understanding will draw it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Most men will proclaim each his own goodness,
But who can find a faithful man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous man walks in his integrity;
His children are blessed after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king who sits on the throne of judgment
Scatters all evil with his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can say, “I have made my heart clean,
I am pure from my sin”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Diverse weights and diverse measures,
They are both alike, an abomination to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even a child is known by his deeds,
Whether what he does is pure and right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hearing ear and the seeing eye,
The Lord has made them both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not love sleep, lest you come to poverty;
Open your eyes, and you will be satisfied with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“It is good for nothing,” cries the buyer;
But when he has gone his way, then he boasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is gold and a multitude of rubies,
But the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take the garment of one who is surety for a stranger,
And hold it as a pledge when it is for a seductress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bread gained by deceit is sweet to a man,
But afterward his mouth will be filled with gravel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Plans are established by counsel;
By wise counsel wage war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets;
Therefore do not associate with one who flatters with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever curses his father or his mother,
His lamp will be put out in deep darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An inheritance gained hastily at the beginning
Will not be blessed at the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say, “I will recompense evil”;
Wait for the Lord, and He will save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Diverse weights are an abomination to the Lord,
And dishonest scales are not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s steps are of the Lord;
How then can a man understand his own way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is a snare for a man to devote rashly something as holy,
And afterward to reconsider his vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise king sifts out the wicked,
And brings the threshing wheel over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The spirit of a man is the lamp of the Lord,
Searching all the inner depths of his heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mercy and truth preserve the king,
And by lovingkindness he upholds his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The glory of young men is their strength,
And the splendor of old men is their gray head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blows that hurt cleanse away evil,
As do stripes the inner depths of the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Every way of a man is right in his own eyes,
But the Lord weighs the hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To do righteousness and justice
Is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A haughty look, a proud heart,
And the plowing of the wicked are sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The plans of the diligent lead surely to plenty,
But those of everyone who is hasty, surely to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Getting treasures by a lying tongue
Is the fleeting fantasy of those who seek death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The violence of the wicked will destroy them,
Because they refuse to do justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of a guilty man is perverse;
But as for the pure, his work is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to dwell in a corner of a housetop,
Than in a house shared with a contentious woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The soul of the wicked desires evil;
His neighbor finds no favor in his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the scoffer is punished, the simple is made wise;
But when the wise is instructed, he receives knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous God wisely considers the house of the wicked,
Overthrowing the wicked for their wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever shuts his ears to the cry of the poor
Will also cry himself and not be heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gift in secret pacifies anger,
And a bribe behind the back, strong wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is a joy for the just to do justice,
But destruction will come to the workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who wanders from the way of understanding
Will rest in the assembly of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who loves pleasure will be a poor man;
He who loves wine and oil will not be rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked shall be a ransom for the righteous,
And the unfaithful for the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better to dwell in the wilderness,
Than with a contentious and angry woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is desirable treasure,
And oil in the dwelling of the wise,
But a foolish man squanders it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who follows righteousness and mercy
Finds life, righteousness, and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man scales the city of the mighty,
And brings down the trusted stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever guards his mouth and tongue
Keeps his soul from troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A proud and haughty man—“Scoffer” is his name;
He acts with arrogant pride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of the lazy man kills him,
For his hands refuse to labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He covets greedily all day long,
But the righteous gives and does not spare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination;
How much more when he brings it with wicked intent!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness shall perish,
But the man who hears him will speak endlessly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked man hardens his face,
But as for the upright, he establishes his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no wisdom or understanding
Or counsel against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The horse is prepared for the day of battle,
But deliverance is of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good name is to be chosen rather than great riches,
Loving favor rather than silver and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich and the poor have this in common,
The Lord is the maker of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A prudent man foresees evil and hides himself,
But the simple pass on and are punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By humility and the fear of the Lord
Are riches and honor and life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse;
He who guards his soul will be far from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Train up a child in the way he should go,
And when he is old he will not depart from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich rules over the poor,
And the borrower is servant to the lender.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who sows iniquity will reap sorrow,
And the rod of his anger will fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who has a generous eye will be blessed,
For he gives of his bread to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast out the scoffer, and contention will leave;
Yes, strife and reproach will cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who loves purity of heart
And has grace on his lips,
The king will be his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge,
But He overthrows the words of the faithless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lazy man says, “There is a lion outside!
I shall be slain in the streets!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of an immoral woman is a deep pit;
He who is abhorred by the Lord will fall there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Foolishness is bound up in the heart of a child;
The rod of correction will drive it far from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who oppresses the poor to increase his riches,
And he who gives to the rich, will surely come to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Incline your ear and hear the words of the wise,
And apply your heart to my knowledge;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is a pleasant thing if you keep them within you;
Let them all be fixed upon your lips,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that your trust may be in the Lord;
I have instructed you today, even you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have I not written to you excellent things
Of counsels and knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That I may make you know the certainty of the words of truth,
That you may answer words of truth
To those who send to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not rob the poor because he is poor,
Nor oppress the afflicted at the gate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will plead their cause,
And plunder the soul of those who plunder them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make no friendship with an angry man,
And with a furious man do not go,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lest you learn his ways
And set a snare for your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be one of those who shakes hands in a pledge,
One of those who is surety for debts;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you have nothing with which to pay,
Why should he take away your bed from under you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not remove the ancient landmark
Which your fathers have set.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When you sit down to eat with a ruler,
Consider carefully what is before you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And put a knife to your throat
If you are a man given to appetite.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not desire his delicacies,
For they are deceptive food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not overwork to be rich;
Because of your own understanding, cease!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not eat the bread of a miser,
Nor desire his delicacies;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For as he thinks in his heart, so is he.
“Eat and drink!” he says to you,
But his heart is not with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The morsel you have eaten, you will vomit up,
And waste your pleasant words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not speak in the hearing of a fool,
For he will despise the wisdom of your words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not remove the ancient landmark,
Nor enter the fields of the fatherless;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their Redeemer is mighty;
He will plead their cause against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Apply your heart to instruction,
And your ears to words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not withhold correction from a child,
For if you beat him with a rod, he will not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall beat him with a rod,
And deliver his soul from hell.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if your heart is wise,
My heart will rejoice—indeed, I myself;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yes, my inmost being will rejoice
When your lips speak right things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let your heart envy sinners,
But be zealous for the fear of the Lord all the day;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For surely there is a hereafter,
And your hope will not be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, my son, and be wise;
And guide your heart in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not mix with winebibbers,
Or with gluttonous eaters of meat;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the drunkard and the glutton will come to poverty,
And drowsiness will clothe a man with rags.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to your father who begot you,
And do not despise your mother when she is old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Buy the truth, and do not sell it,
Also wisdom and instruction and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice,
And he who begets a wise child will delight in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your father and your mother be glad,
And let her who bore you rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, give me your heart,
And let your eyes observe my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a harlot is a deep pit,
And a seductress is a narrow well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She also lies in wait as for a victim,
And increases the unfaithful among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has woe?
Who has sorrow?
Who has contentions?
Who has complaints?
Who has wounds without cause?
Who has redness of eyes?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who linger long at the wine,
Those who go in search of mixed wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
At the last it bites like a serpent,
And stings like a viper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your eyes will see strange things,
And your heart will utter perverse things.
verses.speaker: Narrator
