verses.text:
Yes, you will be like one who lies down in the midst of the sea,
Or like one who lies at the top of the mast, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be envious of evil men,
Nor desire to be with them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their heart devises violence,
And their lips talk of troublemaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Through wisdom a house is built,
And by understanding it is established;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By knowledge the rooms are filled
With all precious and pleasant riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man is strong,
Yes, a man of knowledge increases strength;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For by wise counsel you will wage your own war,
And in a multitude of counselors there is safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is too lofty for a fool;
He does not open his mouth in the gate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who plots to do evil
Will be called a schemer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The devising of foolishness is sin,
And the scoffer is an abomination to men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you faint in the day of adversity,
Your strength is small.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver those who are drawn toward death,
And hold back those stumbling to the slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you say, “Surely we did not know this,”
Does not He who weighs the hearts consider it?
He who keeps your soul, does He not know it?
And will He not render to each man according to his deeds?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, eat honey because it is good,
And the honeycomb which is sweet to your taste;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not lie in wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous;
Do not plunder his resting place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a righteous man may fall seven times
And rise again,
But the wicked shall fall by calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not rejoice when your enemy falls,
And do not let your heart be glad when he stumbles;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lest the Lord see it, and it displease Him,
And He turn away His wrath from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not fret because of evildoers,
Nor be envious of the wicked;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there will be no prospect for the evil man;
The lamp of the wicked will be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, fear the Lord and the king;
Do not associate with those given to change;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For their calamity will rise suddenly,
And who knows the ruin those two can bring?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These things also belong to the wise:
It is not good to show partiality in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But those who rebuke the wicked will have delight,
And a good blessing will come upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He who gives a right answer kisses the lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be a witness against your neighbor without cause,
For would you deceive with your lips?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say, “I will do to him just as he has done to me;
I will render to the man according to his work.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I went by the field of the lazy man,
And by the vineyard of the man devoid of understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
When I saw it, I considered it well;
I looked on it and received instruction:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A little sleep, a little slumber,
A little folding of the hands to rest;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So shall your poverty come like a prowler,
And your need like an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These also are proverbs of Solomon which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is the glory of God to conceal a matter,
But the glory of kings is to search out a matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the heavens for height and the earth for depth,
So the heart of kings is unsearchable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take away the dross from silver,
And it will go to the silversmith for jewelry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take away the wicked from before the king,
And his throne will be established in righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not exalt yourself in the presence of the king,
And do not stand in the place of the great;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is better that he say to you,
“Come up here,”
Than that you should be put lower in the presence of the prince,
Whom your eyes have seen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Debate your case with your neighbor,
And do not disclose the secret to another;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lest he who hears it expose your shame,
And your reputation be ruined.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold
In settings of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like an earring of gold and an ornament of fine gold
Is a wise rebuker to an obedient ear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like the cold of snow in time of harvest
Is a faithful messenger to those who send him,
For he refreshes the soul of his masters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever falsely boasts of giving
Is like clouds and wind without rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By long forbearance a ruler is persuaded,
And a gentle tongue breaks a bone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have you found honey?
Eat only as much as you need,
Lest you be filled with it and vomit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seldom set foot in your neighbor’s house,
Lest he become weary of you and hate you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who bears false witness against his neighbor
Is like a club, a sword, and a sharp arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble
Is like a bad tooth and a foot out of joint.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like one who takes away a garment in cold weather,
And like vinegar on soda,
Is one who sings songs to a heavy heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If your enemy is hungry, give him bread to eat;
And if he is thirsty, give him water to drink;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For so you will heap coals of fire on his head,
And the Lord will reward you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The north wind brings forth rain,
And a backbiting tongue an angry countenance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to dwell in a corner of a housetop,
Than in a house shared with a contentious woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As cold water to a weary soul,
So is good news from a far country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous man who falters before the wicked
Is like a murky spring and a polluted well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not good to eat much honey;
So to seek one’s own glory is not glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever has no rule over his own spirit
Is like a city broken down, without walls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As snow in summer and rain in harvest,
So honor is not fitting for a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a flitting sparrow, like a flying swallow,
So a curse without cause shall not alight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A whip for the horse,
A bridle for the donkey,
And a rod for the fool’s back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not answer a fool according to his folly,
Lest you also be like him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Answer a fool according to his folly,
Lest he be wise in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who sends a message by the hand of a fool
Cuts off his own feet and drinks violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like the legs of the lame that hang limp
Is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like one who binds a stone in a sling
Is he who gives honor to a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a thorn that goes into the hand of a drunkard
Is a proverb in the mouth of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The great God who formed everything
Gives the fool his hire and the transgressor his wages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a dog returns to his own vomit,
So a fool repeats his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you see a man wise in his own eyes?
There is more hope for a fool than for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lazy man says, “There is a lion in the road!
A fierce lion is in the streets!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a door turns on its hinges,
So does the lazy man on his bed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lazy man buries his hand in the bowl;
It wearies him to bring it back to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lazy man is wiser in his own eyes
Than seven men who can answer sensibly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who passes by and meddles in a quarrel not his own
Is like one who takes a dog by the ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Like a madman who throws firebrands, arrows, and death,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is the man who deceives his neighbor,
And says, “I was only joking!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where there is no wood, the fire goes out;
And where there is no talebearer, strife ceases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As charcoal is to burning coals, and wood to fire,
So is a contentious man to kindle strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a talebearer are like tasty trifles,
And they go down into the inmost body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fervent lips with a wicked heart
Are like earthenware covered with silver dross.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who hates, disguises it with his lips,
And lays up deceit within himself;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he speaks kindly, do not believe him,
For there are seven abominations in his heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though his hatred is covered by deceit,
His wickedness will be revealed before the assembly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever digs a pit will fall into it,
And he who rolls a stone will have it roll back on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lying tongue hates those who are crushed by it,
And a flattering mouth works ruin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not boast about tomorrow,
For you do not know what a day may bring forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let another man praise you, and not your own mouth;
A stranger, and not your own lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A stone is heavy and sand is weighty,
But a fool’s wrath is heavier than both of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wrath is cruel and anger a torrent,
But who is able to stand before jealousy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open rebuke is better
Than love carefully concealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Faithful are the wounds of a friend,
But the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A satisfied soul loathes the honeycomb,
But to a hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a bird that wanders from its nest
Is a man who wanders from his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ointment and perfume delight the heart,
And the sweetness of a man’s friend gives delight by hearty counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
My son, be wise, and make my heart glad,
That I may answer him who reproaches me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A prudent man foresees evil and hides himself;
The simple pass on and are punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take the garment of him who is surety for a stranger,
And hold it in pledge when he is surety for a seductress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who blesses his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning,
It will be counted a curse to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A continual dripping on a very rainy day
And a contentious woman are alike;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever restrains her restrains the wind,
And grasps oil with his right hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As iron sharpens iron,
So a man sharpens the countenance of his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever keeps the fig tree will eat its fruit;
So he who waits on his master will be honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As in water face reflects face,
So a man’s heart reveals the man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hell and Destruction are never full;
So the eyes of man are never satisfied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The refining pot is for silver and the furnace for gold,
And a man is valued by what others say of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though you grind a fool in a mortar with a pestle along with crushed grain,
Yet his foolishness will not depart from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be diligent to know the state of your flocks,
And attend to your herds;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For riches are not forever,
Nor does a crown endure to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the hay is removed, and the tender grass shows itself,
And the herbs of the mountains are gathered in,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lambs will provide your clothing,
And the goats the price of a field;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall have enough goats’ milk for your food,
For the food of your household,
And the nourishment of your maidservants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked flee when no one pursues,
But the righteous are bold as a lion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
A poor man who oppresses the poor
Is like a driving rain which leaves no food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who forsake the law praise the wicked,
But such as keep the law contend with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evil men do not understand justice,
But those who seek the Lord understand all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is the poor who walks in his integrity
Than one perverse in his ways, though he be rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever keeps the law is a discerning son,
But a companion of gluttons shames his father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who increases his possessions by usury and extortion
Gathers it for him who will pity the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One who turns away his ear from hearing the law,
Even his prayer is an abomination.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The rich man is wise in his own eyes,
But the poor who has understanding searches him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the righteous rejoice, there is great glory;
But when the wicked arise, men hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who covers his sins will not prosper,
But whoever confesses and forsakes them will have mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy is the man who is always reverent,
But he who hardens his heart will fall into calamity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Like a roaring lion and a charging bear
Is a wicked ruler over poor people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A ruler who lacks understanding is a great oppressor,
But he who hates covetousness will prolong his days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man burdened with bloodshed will flee into a pit;
Let no one help him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever walks blamelessly will be saved,
But he who is perverse in his ways will suddenly fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who tills his land will have plenty of bread,
But he who follows frivolity will have poverty enough!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A faithful man will abound with blessings,
But he who hastens to be rich will not go unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To show partiality is not good,
Because for a piece of bread a man will transgress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man with an evil eye hastens after riches,
And does not consider that poverty will come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who rebukes a man will find more favor afterward
Than he who flatters with the tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever robs his father or his mother,
And says, “It is no transgression,”
The same is companion to a destroyer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is of a proud heart stirs up strife,
But he who trusts in the Lord will be prospered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who trusts in his own heart is a fool,
But whoever walks wisely will be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who gives to the poor will not lack,
But he who hides his eyes will have many curses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked arise, men hide themselves;
But when they perish, the righteous increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is often rebuked, and hardens his neck,
Will suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice;
But when a wicked man rules, the people groan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever loves wisdom makes his father rejoice,
But a companion of harlots wastes his wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king establishes the land by justice,
But he who receives bribes overthrows it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who flatters his neighbor
Spreads a net for his feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By transgression an evil man is snared,
But the righteous sings and rejoices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous considers the cause of the poor,
But the wicked does not understand such knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Scoffers set a city aflame,
But wise men turn away wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a wise man contends with a foolish man,
Whether the fool rages or laughs, there is no peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The bloodthirsty hate the blameless,
But the upright seek his well-being.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool vents all his feelings,
But a wise man holds them back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a ruler pays attention to lies,
All his servants become wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor man and the oppressor have this in common:
The Lord gives light to the eyes of both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king who judges the poor with truth,
His throne will be established forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rod and rebuke give wisdom,
But a child left to himself brings shame to his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increases;
But the righteous will see their fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Correct your son, and he will give you rest;
Yes, he will give delight to your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where there is no revelation, the people cast off restraint;
But happy is he who keeps the law.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A servant will not be corrected by mere words;
For though he understands, he will not respond.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do you see a man hasty in his words?
There is more hope for a fool than for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who pampers his servant from childhood
Will have him as a son in the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An angry man stirs up strife,
And a furious man abounds in transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s pride will bring him low,
But the humble in spirit will retain honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever is a partner with a thief hates his own life;
He swears to tell the truth, but reveals nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of man brings a snare,
But whoever trusts in the Lord shall be safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many seek the ruler’s favor,
But justice for man comes from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An unjust man is an abomination to the righteous,
And he who is upright in the way is an abomination to the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, his utterance. This man declared to Ithiel—to Ithiel and Ucal:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely I am more stupid than any man,
And do not have the understanding of a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I neither learned wisdom
Nor have knowledge of the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has ascended into heaven, or descended?
Who has gathered the wind in His fists?
Who has bound the waters in a garment?
Who has established all the ends of the earth?
What is His name, and what is His Son’s name,
If you know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every word of God is pure;
He is a shield to those who put their trust in Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not add to His words,
Lest He rebuke you, and you be found a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Two things I request of You
(Deprive me not before I die):
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lest I be full and deny You,
And say, “Who is the Lord?”
Or lest I be poor and steal,
And profane the name of my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not malign a servant to his master,
Lest he curse you, and you be found guilty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a generation that curses its father,
And does not bless its mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a generation that is pure in its own eyes,
Yet is not washed from its filthiness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a generation—oh, how lofty are their eyes!
And their eyelids are lifted up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a generation whose teeth are like swords,
And whose fangs are like knives,
To devour the poor from off the earth,
And the needy from among men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The leech has two daughters—
Give and Give! 
There are three things that are never satisfied,
Four never say, “Enough!”:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The grave,
The barren womb,
The earth that is not satisfied with water—
And the fire never says, “Enough!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eye that mocks his father,
And scorns obedience to his mother,
The ravens of the valley will pick it out,
And the young eagles will eat it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are three things which are too wonderful for me,
Yes, four which I do not understand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of an eagle in the air,
The way of a serpent on a rock,
The way of a ship in the midst of the sea,
And the way of a man with a virgin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the way of an adulterous woman:
She eats and wipes her mouth,
And says, “I have done no wickedness.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For three things the earth is perturbed,
Yes, for four it cannot bear up:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a servant when he reigns,
A fool when he is filled with food,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A hateful woman when she is married,
And a maidservant who succeeds her mistress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are four things which are little on the earth,
But they are exceedingly wise:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ants are a people not strong,
Yet they prepare their food in the summer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rock badgers are a feeble folk,
Yet they make their homes in the crags;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The locusts have no king,
Yet they all advance in ranks;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The spider skillfully grasps with its hands,
And it is in kings’ palaces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are three things which are majestic in pace,
Yes, four which are stately in walk:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A lion, which is mighty among beasts
And does not turn away from any;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A greyhound,
A male goat also,
And a king whose troops are with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you have been foolish in exalting yourself,
Or if you have devised evil, put your hand on your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For as the churning of milk produces butter,
And wringing the nose produces blood,
So the forcing of wrath produces strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The words of King Lemuel, the utterance which his mother taught him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What, my son?
And what, son of my womb?
And what, son of my vows?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not give your strength to women,
Nor your ways to that which destroys kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lest they drink and forget the law,
And pervert the justice of all the afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give strong drink to him who is perishing,
And wine to those who are bitter of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let him drink and forget his poverty,
And remember his misery no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open your mouth for the speechless,
In the cause of all who are appointed to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Open your mouth, judge righteously,
And plead the cause of the poor and needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can find a virtuous wife?
For her worth is far above rubies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of her husband safely trusts her;
So he will have no lack of gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She does him good and not evil
All the days of her life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She seeks wool and flax,
And willingly works with her hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is like the merchant ships,
She brings her food from afar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She also rises while it is yet night,
And provides food for her household,
And a portion for her maidservants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She considers a field and buys it;
From her profits she plants a vineyard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She girds herself with strength,
And strengthens her arms.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She perceives that her merchandise is good,
And her lamp does not go out by night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She stretches out her hands to the distaff,
And her hand holds the spindle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She extends her hand to the poor,
Yes, she reaches out her hands to the needy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is not afraid of snow for her household,
For all her household is clothed with scarlet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She makes tapestry for herself;
Her clothing is fine linen and purple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her husband is known in the gates,
When he sits among the elders of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She makes linen garments and sells them,
And supplies sashes for the merchants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Strength and honor are her clothing;
She shall rejoice in time to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She opens her mouth with wisdom,
And on her tongue is the law of kindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She watches over the ways of her household,
And does not eat the bread of idleness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her children rise up and call her blessed;
Her husband also, and he praises her:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Many daughters have done well,
But you excel them all.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Charm is deceitful and beauty is passing,
But a woman who fears the Lord, she shall be praised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give her of the fruit of her hands,
And let her own works praise her in the gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator
